Posts.Content: Dear Trudi just try to stay strong you WILL get through it in the end with or without your uncaring family!!I also became very bitter and twisted about certain family members (most of them I no longer bother with!)I also have lost a few so called 'friends' who now never visit or even bother to email!I have turned to the people I love and trust best ( there are not many of them,)mainly my husband and daughters.You have been through an awful lot and it is only natural to feel like this,give yourself a big pat on the back for getting this far..and keep fighting and be more selfish (like they are)By the way you are also beautiful!!! Julie
Posts.Title: I am experienceing anger at my family andfeel awful about it

Posts.Content: Thanks for that Wendy, guess all will return to normal soon ...just the cleaning thing I have a good excuse now to do hardly any haha!!!Julie x
Posts.Title: finger nails and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I am new to this great site, and wish I had joined before!I live abroad and although Im getting good care I feel very alone.I had a lumpectomy to remove a small 7mm tumour and the first lymph node removed.I had a second op.to remove more of the 'margin' before chemo.but the cells were ok !I am having my fourth cycle in the morning, and dreading it.Does anyone have advice on how to prevent nausea?I do take pills for it and one extra if it fails to place under the tongue.I try to drink a lot of water, as I'm told this helps too.I'm returning to walking and swimming and feel quite well/positive but have low day's when I feel it may not work, and I get scared.Since my third chemo my nail beds look blue/purple on and off during the day,has anyone else noticed this?Could it be a heart/oxygen problem? julie
Posts.Title: finger nails and chemo

Posts.Content: Thank you so much, they are the pills that I take already, guess I must take them maybe before the nausea kicks in!!!I already feel better knowing I have support on this website!thanks again Julie
Posts.Title: finger nails and chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks for the info I'm guessing that I will be on a Tax type drug,it seems standard for breast cancer.I will ask in the morning though,just in case.Guessing I'm getting  a bit paranoid (more than usual!!!)I'm finishing first half now, 4 more of new cocktail to go, hopefully may not feel as bad!I'm not feeling as isolated now already by using this site, I feel much more supported thanks x
Posts.Title: finger nails and chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks for you support and reply, good luck with all your care too!
Posts.Title: finger nails and chemo

Posts.Content: Thank's Katharine!it will be nice to put some make up on maybe to cheer me up a bit,feeling a bit more 'hombre' lately haha!!x
Posts.Title: steroids

Posts.Content: Thanks Monika, two members have mentioned taking them early evening!My husband also has that type of humour, it helps get us through the 'down days.' He actually shaved my hair off and burst into tears after bless him!I have now stopped wearing head covers in bed and we do have a standing joke ....what if we get a burglar/rapist ???they may grab the wrong one haha!!!he also strokes my head and say's 'oh your'e such a pretty little boy' he often get's a good swipe with the fly squatter (my hand accidentally slips) x
Posts.Title: steroids

Posts.Content: Thanks a lot mmmm I love Mahou myself lol!!!x
Posts.Title: steroids

Posts.Content: Hi again everybody, thanks again for all you support yesterday and prompt answers to my questions.If you remember I'm one of the ladies who live in Spain, the area is a village between Baza and Granada.If there is anyone in my area (I do understand it's a big country!)I would be happy to be a friend ....Today I finished my first 4 chemo's!!!feeling kind of ok too (hope it last's)I'm having the new cycle on 24th of this month and just wondered how other members found it?I now keep getting very anxious and worrying it will be 'worse' more nausea etc.I have also been issued with steroids to take the night before,one the same day and one more that night.The oncologist said this is to prevent allergy,is this normal procedure?I also found out today that even though I SO suffer with hayfever my continued runny/itchy  eyes are a side -effect of the chemo too!!!Feeling very ugly today with red eyes and bald head haha!!!Not so much Sinead O'Conner ..more Des O'Conner!! julie james
Posts.Title: steroids
